Hello everyone!
I'm developing a custom quote template and I'm wondering how to deal with translations. I can see this line in the base.html layout
```{# Retrieve translations for the template #}
{% set template_translations = load_translations('../_locales', html_lang, 'en') %}```
but then I can't figure out how to use the different locales in the quote template.
I trivially tried `{% set template_translations = load_translations('../_locales', 'fr', 'en') %}` just to verify if it would load French translations but to no avail.
Also, in the quote editor "quote language" is grayed out (see attached image), so it doesn't seem possible to change the language.

According to the following
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CRM/Custom-quote-template-translation/m-p/547822>
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Custom-Quote-Template-Beta/Change-languange-when-creating-a-quote/m-p/436761>
it seems this feature is not implemented yet, is this the case? If so, I'm guessing that currently the only solution is to create different coded templates for the various languages, create the corresponding customized quote template and select the appropriate one in the quote wizard (see "quote template" in the attached image).
Is this the right approach? <@U01QVR44MEY> do you have any advice or personal experience on this by chance?
Or maybe, one has to create different custom coded quote templates and hardcode the various labels and stuff for the different languages, ignoring the locales folder. It feels a bit intricate though.
Thank you.

It's a little bit of a strange one, when you're setting up the templates in the editor in settings you have to select a language, but the default templates can use any language and you can select it from the quote builder. I think you might have to create a new template (use the same coded quote template though) for the different languages, unless anyone else has any better ideas.
